8.14.24  2:36 pm   Hi Bill. I've been thinking about this topic for a few years now and I'm wondering if you have some more insight into it and experience with this same thought pattern... and hopefully some sort of an swer or solution that can help me out. I'm in sort of a thou ght loop to do with productivity, goals, and doing the things I WANT to be doing, but find myself NOT doing. For example, I'm a musician as well and I want to be writing more music and practicing piano more. I'm also a drumme r and keep up with that because I'm currently in a band, which is something holding me to improving and being creative... all that. The problem is, I have nothing holding me to writing songs in any particular time frame, or m aking me practice piano, practice singing... etc. I have FLStudio and want to put some more time into learning the platform, but I'm struggling a lot with the learning curve of even starting out and making something simple. Basically what my question boils down to is this: how do I get myself to do the delayed gratification things I WANT to be working t owards and improving at when all I seem to want to do is quick dopamine rel ease like watching YouTube and playing video games? I'm in a weird spot on my thoughts about it because part of me thinks "I have my whole life to wri te music, make an album I'm proud of, (insert long term goal), etc... so ea ch day it seems almost pointless to start, and very difficult to find the m otivation to do it and enjoy doing it. Should I wait until the days I decid e I feel like working on something and very slowly work towards my goals, o r set more attainable short-term goals to keep me on track? I've tried both and I still feel like I could be making more progress... I feel like I'm g onna end up 45 years old and still not comfortable and capable on piano and all that and still struggling to write anything, wishing I used the hours of free time I had when I was younger... I know this is a fucking essay at this point but, thoughts on all that? Have you found your self thinking similar things? Is it really enough to just very slowly work towards it when I feel the motivation? Thanks.
